item.title: Why doesn't this work?
item.dc:creator: @BorigTheDwarf BorigTheDwarf
item.description:

Yes, I know every +4 height levels is a new world. Had to learn that when I wrote the jad minigame.
[/quote]
Exactly.

Which means he is skipping about 120+ worlds :[/quote]

He could have already used those for something else. I think you guys are getting way off topic now. It doesn’t matter, it works, is simple and doesn’t have any difference than if he had used another number.

Read full topic

item.title: Why doesn't this work?
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

AtomicInt_:

So the integers value * 500, why in the hell is that the height?

Guys can you please stop posting and asking about the same problem over and over again…

The reason is because every 4 floors the world resets… He just messed up and did 500 instead of 400 or just 4.

That code just makes it so you are teleported to a world that no one else is in.

Read full topic

item.title: Why doesn't this work?
item.dc:creator: @BorigTheDwarf BorigTheDwarf
item.description:
@BorigTheDwarf wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:12, topic:439770”][quote author=BorigTheDwarf link=topic=542462.msg3975617#msg3975617 date=1334620691]

What’s up with the playerID*500? I don’t think it’s necessary to move someone 500 floors… that could easily be the error o.O 500 floors don’t exist

This would be my first guess^^

I am fairly certain the floor id*500 will work just fine. But it is much better just to do the playerId * 5 (every 5 height levels it repeats meaning you can create a floor for each person based on their playerId. The height level client sided will be stored in an integer.

I think Ashton51 was probably on the right track.

Every 4 it repeats, actually

Are you taking the initial ‘floor 0’ into account?

It does repeat every 4, Because height 0 is ground level.

But that still wouldn’t prevent it from working, It would just take you to a different floor.

Exactly, the error is in a piece of code that hasn’t been shown. Don’t make remarks on code which is irrelevant to the problem, I am sure he has his reasons.
[/quote]
Actually, my remark was completely relevant to the code. It might not be relevant to his problem, but I did provide knowledge that was necessary. It may help him in the future.

And even if what I said was irrelevant, you’re only posting here to point out my irrelevancy. What have you done to fix his problem?[/quote]

Check out what you said and then apply it to yourself and you will see the answer is the same for both of us. So if it doesn’t apply for me, why should it apply for you? Also, you didn’t read what I said. But whatevs brah.

Read full topic

I am fairly certain the floor id*500 will work just fine. But it is much better just to do the playerId * 5 (every 5 height levels it repeats meaning you can create a floor for each person based on their playerId. The height level client sided will be stored in an integer.

I think Ashton51 was probably on the right track.

Every 4 it repeats, actually

Are you taking the initial ‘floor 0’ into account?

It does repeat every 4, Because height 0 is ground level.

But that still wouldn’t prevent it from working, It would just take you to a different floor.
[/quote]

Exactly, the error is in a piece of code that hasn’t been shown. Don’t make remarks on code which is irrelevant to the problem, I am sure he has his reasons.[/quote]

And even if what I said was irrelevant, you’re only posting here to point out my irrelevancy. What have you done to fix his problem?

item.title: Why doesn't this work?
item.dc:creator: @EXIL3 EXIL3
item.description:
@EXIL3 wrote:

[quote=“Ashton51, post:2, topic:439770”]Well the problem could be a number of things.

It could be because the newDung() is returning true, or that inDung is returning false.

Also with an else if statement, That code will only execute if the original if statement is false.

For example

If(Condition A)
Action A
else if (Condition B)
Action B
else
Action C

What happens is it will check if Condition A is true, If it is then it will execute Condition A.
If Condition A is not true, Then it will check if Condition B is true, and if Condition A is false AND condition B is true then it will execute Action B

Get it?[/quote]
I get it

Read full topic

item.title: Why doesn't this work?
item.dc:creator: @BorigTheDwarf BorigTheDwarf
item.description:
@BorigTheDwarf wrote:

[quote=“Daginith, post:4, topic:439770”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=542462.msg3975091#msg3975091 date=1334547453]
What’s up with the playerID*500? I don’t think it’s necessary to move someone 500 floors… that could easily be the error o.O 500 floors don’t exist
[/quote]
This would be my first guess^^[/quote]

I am fairly certain the floor id*500 will work just fine. But it is much better just to do the playerId * 5 (every 5 height levels it repeats meaning you can create a floor for each person based on their playerId. The height level client sided will be stored in an integer.

I think Ashton51 was probably on the right track.

Read full topic

item.title: Why doesn't this work?
item.dc:creator: @Ashton51 Ashton51
item.description:
@Ashton51 wrote:

Well the problem could be a number of things.

It could be because the newDung() is returning true, or that inDung is returning false.

Also with an else if statement, That code will only execute if the original if statement is false.

For example

If(Condition A)
Action A
else if (Condition B)
Action B
else
Action C

What happens is it will check if Condition A is true, If it is then it will execute Condition A.
If Condition A is not true, Then it will check if Condition B is true, and if Condition A is false AND condition B is true then it will execute Action B

Get it?

Read full topic

item.title: Why doesn't this work?
item.dc:creator: @EXIL3 EXIL3
item.description:
@EXIL3 wrote:

else if (!newDung() && inDung == true) { getPA().movePlayer(2634, 4691, playerId*500); }
That would mean if the player isn’t in newDung() and inDung == true; the player gets teleported back to the specified coordinates if i’m right… Why doesn’t it work?

Read full topic
